ca.uqac.lif.fs

Class FlatFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.fs.RamDisk
      • ca.uqac.lif.fs.FlatFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystem

    public class FlatFileSystem
extends RamDisk
    A file system that exposes files in a hierarchy of directory, but internally stores them in a file system that has a flat structure.

    More precisely, the file system associates an absolute path for a file or a folder to a "flat" filename made of the hex string of that path. For instance:

    • foo becomes 666f6f
    • /foo/bar.txt becomes 2f666f6f2f6261722e747874
    The class makes the filename conversion back and forth with the underlying file system, thus simulating the presence of a folder structure on a file system that does not necessarily support it directly. For example, one can store a nested directory structure into a flat key-value store, such as a distributed hash table or a relational database.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

                             throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Reads data from a file. The method provides an InputStream from which data can be read. Consumers of this input stream have the responsibility to close the stream after usage.

        Overrides:
        readFrom in class RamDisk
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which data is to be written
        Returns:
        A print stream open on the file. If the method successfully returns, it guarantees that this stream is not null
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • writeTo

        public java.io.OutputStream writeTo(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Writes data to a file. The method provides an OutputStream to which data can be printed. The data is guaranteed to be committed to the file only when the print stream is closed. Whether data is written before that moment depends on the actual file system implementation.
        Specified by:
        writeTo in interface FileSystem
        Overrides:

      • toFlatFilename

        public static java.lang.String toFlatFilename(FilePath path)
        Converts an absolute path into a flat filename. The method does so by printing the hex value of each character in the string.
        Parameters:
        path - The file path
        Returns:
        The corresponding flat filename
